# Question

You are given a list of daily temperature data `temps` (numbers). Write a function `weather_data_analyzer` that performs statistical analyses on this data (use `Statistics` package). The function should return results in named tuple (construct it with `(; key1=value1,key2=value2)` syntax) containing the `average`, `max`, `min` temperatures, and a `trend` (can be only: `:increasing`, `:decreasing`, or `:stable`). If the list is empty, the function should return a named tuple with all values set to `nothing`.

```julia
using Statistics

struct WeatherDataAnalyzer
average::Float64
max::Float64
min::Float64
trend::String
end

function weather_data_analyzer(temps::Array{Float64})
if isempty(temps)
return WeatherDataAnalyzer(nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing)
else
average = mean(temps)
max_temp = maximum(temps)
min_temp = minimum(temps)
trend = get_trend(temps)
return WeatherDataAnalyzer(average, max_temp, min_temp, trend)
end
end

function get_trend(temps::Array{Float64})
if all(x == y for x, y in zip(temps[1:], temps[2:])) || all(x == y for x, y in zip(temps[:-1], temps[1:]))
return "stable"
else if is_increasing(temps)
return "increasing"
else if is_decreasing(temps)
return "decreasing"
end
end

function is_increasing(temps::Array{Float64})
all(x < y for x, y in zip(temps[1:], temps[2:]))
end

function is_decreasing(temps::Array{Float64})
all(x > y for x, y in zip(temps[1:], temps[2:]))
end
```
